item.title: Report X-2024030379
item.description:
Report X-2024030379

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading trailer 557169 from SCHG the haz mat was discovered wet and had leaked onto another haz mat package. Both haz mats were put in totes and taking to the Haz Mat cage for inspection. DescribePack: Found a crack on the damaged bottle. On the inside of the handle the seam is cracked about an inch or more. Hard to see the crack initially. The outer package was so damaged from the leak that the top half of the box was gone. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: There was no more leaking once package was found. Cleaned up any mess leftover and put all bottles upright in totes and put in hazmat cage.

  • Description: 1. X-2024030380 SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: One jug in the box was leaking contents from a loose cap. The box and both jugs inside were also leaked on and soiled by a damaged box of paint. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote. 2. X-2024030381 SequenceEvent: The jerrican was found damaged in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: The jerrican was dropped onto a bolt on the floor, puncturing the bottom and causing contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The jerrican was placed upside down, with the puncture on top, into a hazbag lined tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a leaking hazmat, when admin arrived package was already in a lined tote with a large puddle of product on the floor from where it had been leaking. Spill pads were used to clean up large quantity of spilled product then neutralizer was used over top of spill. After neutralizer sat for a minute it was swept up. DescribePack: Body of hard plastic bag inside of fiberboard box looked as if a side seam burst due to impact with the floor or another hard object. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was kept in a lined tote in an upright postion.

item.title: Report X-2024030145
item.description:
Report X-2024030145

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: PARSIPPANY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CONTENTS OF A NEXT DAY AIR PACKAGE WERE INSPECTED DUE TO THE OUTER BOX BEING MARKED AS FROZEN BAKED GOODS AND BEING COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY EIGHT POUNDS OF DRY ICE BLOCKS COOLING FROZEN BAKED GOODS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THERE IS A YELLOW THERM-O-CHILL OVERNITE SHIPPERS POLAR TECH INDUSTRIES INC STICKER APPLIED. OUTER BOX IS A THERMO CHILL INSULATED SHIPPERS BOX PREPRINTED RUSH AND PERISHABLE WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM ONT TO ANC AND ANC TO ENA.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LTU experienced a battery acid release from a 1750-pound UN2794 battery. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released to a 10 x 20 area of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading/pallet failure. Absorbents and soda ash were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted area. The battery was up righted and re-secured for shipment on. All impacted absorbents, pallet wood, and PPE were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN3082 Mesotrione 40% SC release from a 135-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 10 x 15 area of the concrete dock floor due to a puncture caused by other freight during dock operations. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents, pads, and PPE into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 12-ounces of product released to a 2 x 6 area of the metal drum lid/body. The release was due to the drum having the incorrect bung cap placed on it. The bung was replaced with a new one and secured for shipment on. The impacted drums were wiped down with absorbent pads which were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024030019
item.description:
Report I-2024030019

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: Cincinnati
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver arrived at customer to fill a Ammonia Tank. He verified everything on the BulldMiniBulk Checklist to verify all connections and tank was ready to complete off load. Customer signed off before the off load. Customer and driver gave each other thumbs up from a distance. The driver thought that was an indication good to start the pump off. Shortly after driver started the pump, he heard a boom noise, exited the truck and noticed the product Ieaking from the pump. He imniediately turned off the pump. The customer notified his team and the product was contained and cleaned on site immediately. The cause of the release was determined to be the customer had not released the internal valve and water in the dyke area causing deadhead back to the pump. Univar maintenance and Vendor maintenance determined the vibration and stress caused a crack in suction pipe into pump causing the leak. The crack was welded and further tests on pipe and pump resulted in no further leaks or releases.

item.title: Report I-2024030014
item.description:
Report I-2024030014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: Lynchburg
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLI TRANSPORT, LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Company Fuel Driver was making a fuel delivery at store at 09:03am, the driver had two hoses of connected from the trailer belly valves to the underground fuel storage tank(UST). Cones were in place to protect the area as well as lights activated for warnings. A white pickup truck(Super Duty) bearing Maryland registration# 9EC0549, pulling a - cement mixer trailer, disregarded the activated lights and orange security cones of our vehicle; drove over the hose fitting connected to the UST and tore the fitting and the lip of the UST off the tank. The hose attached to the trailer UST became stuck under the pickup truck. The driver exited their truck and removed the hose from under his truck; and left the scene immediately. Police report was filed with VA State Police(Trooper J.B. Moore) for truck"leaving th scene of the accident". Fuel driver managed to capture a photo of the truck that ran over the fitting and hoses and reported the incident to Law Enforcement and the Safety Department immediately. Material spilled was contained by the fuel driver using absorbent pads, and emptied the remaining fuel in the hose into the UST. No fuel contaminated the ground nor entered into any water systems.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02/15/2024, during the boarding phase of flight DL2019, a passenger's carry-on bag in the overhead bin went into thermal runaway. The Flight Attendants heard a"pop" and saw flames in the overhead bin at row 11. Flight Attendants initiated an evacuation using the jetway. Customer removed the bag from the overhead and stepped on it to extinguish the fire. The flight attendants were on their way to retrieve the containment bag/water. ARFF responded, determined multi loose Li-ion batteries and coins arched and started the fire. No fire extinguisher or 02 masks were used. The affected overhead bin has no damage other than smoke soot residue. No Flight Attendant or customer injuries were reported. The NRC and FAA were notified.

item.title: Report X-2024030126
item.description:
Report X-2024030126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CONTENTS OF AN AIR PACKAGE SHIPPED FROM COLOMBIA TO THE USA WERE INSPECTED DUE TO A STRONG ACETONE ODOR COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS, ONE CONTAINER OF LUMELI REMOVEDOR DE ESMALTE TRANSLATED AS LUMELI NAIL POLISH REMOVER WAS FOUND LEAKING. THE LEAK WAS CONTAINED WITHIN THE PACKAGE WITH JUST A SMALL STAIN ON THE OUTER PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN PREVIOUSLY INSPECTED BY CUSTOMS OFFICIALS IN MIAMI PRIOR TO BEING RELEASED INTO THE UPS NETWORK. THERE IS "OPENED FOR CUSTOMS PURPOSES" TAPE SURROUNDING THE PACKAGE AND SURROUNDING THE LUMELI NAIL POLISH REMOVER INSIDE THE BOX. THE PACKAGE SCANS IN THE UPS NETWORK AS UPS SMALL PACKAGE TRACKING 1ZB6864V0423811919 BUT ALL THERMAL TRACKING LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGE SHOW COLOMBIA NATIONAL POSTAL SERVICE, 4-72, TRACKING NUMBER CP0051323737CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM COLOMBIA USING UPS ACCOUNT B6864V, ANICAM COLOMBIA SAS, TV 93 #53-32 BODEGA 13, PARQUE EMPRESARIAL EL DORADO, BOGOTA DC 110911 COLOMBIA.

  • Description: On February 27, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printer ink was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. Personnel placed the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum, and they deployed granular absorbents to the released product and swept them in with hand tools. One (1) 55-gallon drum of spent absorbents, PPE, and any cleanup debris was staged in the terminal's waste holding room along with the 85-gallon salvage drum that contained the damaged drum. All undamaged freight was staged on the dock for further handling by R+L personnel.

  • City: RICHMOND

  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02/14/2024 at 1812, personnel in the CSXT Acca Yard reported UTLX 210839, a loaded tank car of Alcohols N.O.S., was suspected to be leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Valero Marketing, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024-02-14-00201). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, and Blaise MacDonald, a CSXT hazardous materials manager, were dispatched to the scene and found the manway cover was mis-aligned allowing the release; additionally, seven out of eight manway cover bolts were less than tool tight. Response personnel inspected the manway cover gasket and properly secured the manway cover for transportation. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative (Judy Watson 210-934-8157).

  • Description: Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by RDX personnel in Williston, FL regarding the assistance with a (1) gallon spill of Sectagon K54 (UN3266,8,PG II). The product was released from a poly tote onto the trailer floor at a terminal. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of Sectagon K54. Contractors were able to clean and neutralize the release with ABZORBIT PREMIUM ABSORBENT and the proper PPE. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55- gallon poly drum which was taken off-site for proper disposal.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: CHICKASHA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COFFEYVILLE RESOUCES CRUDE TRANSPORTATION, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The transport was headed West on HWY 39 when the driver turned to enter the Enable Naples unload station, Crude Oil began to spill along side the trailer. The transport stopped and proceeded to call his supervisor. When the supervisor arrived, along with internal environmental personnel it was determined that driver was responsible for the spill. The driver did admit he had failed to close the fire valve and vent line valve on his trailer. The environmental clean up crew and local authorities were alerted. The environmental crew arrived at 7:53am. They spread powder absorbent on the highway and used a street sweeper to cleanup the residue. No waste was generated and no manifest produced for disposal. Work was completed at 8:33am. There was a local sheriff vehicle at the intersection at 5am but they left as soon as CRCT personnel arrived. No other authorities from Grady County were ever on site.

  • Description: On February 27, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3265 was damaged and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior, asphalt, and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the dock floor, trailer interior and asphalt and swept them in with hand tools. The residual product within the punctured tote was emptied and transferred to a new 330-gallon tote. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The damaged tote was deconstructed with hand tools and placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged on site

  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5-gallons of UN2672 Ammonium Hydroxide (10-35%) released from a 5-gallon poly jug due to a forklift puncture impacting a 1'X5' area of the trailer floor. No storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. Absorbents were applied in the trailer and swept up. Soda Ash solution was used to neutralize the impacted area. Impacted absorbents, PPE and the empty jug were containerized and overpacked into one 55-gallon poly drum of waste and staged in terminal OS&D for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030135
item.description:
Report E-2024030135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: DAVENPORT
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was stopping at the end of his day and was completing the Post-trip inspection when noticed liquids drippings from trailer onto his tire at 1800. The driver grabed some absorbent to contain the liquid and called our emergency response at 1806. A team was dispatched out to address the release 1830. The crew arrived on scene at around 1900 and added more absorbents to provide a containment and monitoring. Equipment was need to gain access to the containers as the trailer was double stacked and full. The equipment was on scene by 0700 and unloading began. The container was reached by 0900 and found that there was a small dent in the bottom chime which a small hole was found. The material was cleaned up using absorbent pads and was disposed of per the proper requirements. The trailer was then reloaded and secured by around 1700 and driver was sent on his way.

  • Description: DURING PACKAGE HANDLING AN AIR PACKAGE WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. THE PACKAGE HANDLER ALSO NOTICED THE SOUND OF DRY ICE PELLETS MOVING INSIDE THE BOX. RESPONDER INSPECTED AND FOUND APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING FOOD. THE OUTER BOX IS PREPRINTED PERISHABLE AND FRAGILE WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM PA USING UPS ACCOUNT 853E2X, CHOANIES BAKERY, 605 HAZEL ST, LEBANON PA 17042. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS CONSUMER COMMODITY ID8000 WITH A CLASS 9 DIAMOND LABEL, AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING, AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY IN THE NETHERLANDS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE PRODUCT LEAKING DUE TO THE CLOSURE BEING PRESSED DOWN BY OTHER PRODUCTS WITHIN THE PACKAGE. SOME ABSORBENT LINING WAS INSIDE THE PACKAGE WHICH HELPED CONTROL THE EXTENT OF LEAK OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE AND CONTENTS HAVE BEEN PROCESSED THROUGH THE NORMAL DISPOSAL PROCEDURES. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM THE NETHERLANDS GOING TO THE USA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B567JO, ARVATO BENELUX BV, BREM 1, HEIJEN NETHERLANDS 6598MH.

Report X-2024030014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS INFORMED OF A POTENTIAL HAZMAT LEAKER ON THE UNLOAD IRREG BELT. ARRIVING RESPONDER WAS POINTED TOWARDS SEVERAL HAZMAT PACKAGES ON THE BELT AND WAS TOLD THERE WAS A STRONG CHEMICAL ODOR COMING FROM ONE OF THE PACKAGES. SORTING THROUGH THE PACKAGES RESPONDER FOUND THIS HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT HAD A STRONG ODOR COMING FROM IT. OPENING THE PACKAGE FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS AND UPON FORTHER INSPECTION FOUND ONE OF THE CAPS TO BE EXTREMELY LOOSE WHICH ALLOWED SOME OF THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT AND WET THE INTERNAL CARDBOARD LAYER.

item.description:
Report X-2024030087

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE HAZ-MAT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING AT 19:20 ON THE HVD OF THE PD-1 BELT IN THE EARTH CITY, MO UPS HUB. THE SPILLAGE WAS CLEANED, CONTAINED, AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. AN EXTERNAL INSPECTION SHOWED DENTED CORNERS. THE INTERNAL INSPECTION REVEALED NO PACKING MATERIAL TO PROTECT THE INNER RECEPTICLES (1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES) FROM THE SHIPPING PROCESS. ONE BOTTLE HAD A CRACKED CAP. ALL MATERIAL HAS BEEN PROCESSED THROUGH THE UPS DAMAGED MATERIALS PROGRAM.

item.title: Report X-2024030076
item.description:
Report X-2024030076

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-24
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY A CLERK IN SMALL SORT WHO DETECTED A STRONG ODOR EMANATING FROM THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP FLOOR AND GIVEN TO A RESPONDER. UPON INSPECTION THE PACKAGE DID NOT HAVE ANY PHYSICAL SIGNS OF LEAKAGE BUT DID IN FACT SMELL STRONGLY OF SOLVENT. HAZMAT LABELLING ON THE PACKAGE FURTHER INDICATED THE PRODUCT INSIDE HAD BEEN COMPROMISED AND NEEDED TO BE CONTAINED IMMEDIATELY. PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND THE PRODUCT WAS CLEARLY HEAVILY SOILED FROM INTERNAL LEAKAGE, WHICH WAS MOSTLY CONTAINED VIA PLASTIC WRAPPING OVER PRODUCT, HOWEVER VAPOR WAS ESCAPING. PRODUCT WAS IMMEDIATELY BAGGED WITH LIQUIDS PRESENT TO PREVENT FURTHER VAPOR RELEASE.

The damaged box and 4 other boxes that were leaked on, were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper. Both pallets had 1 box that was damaged. Inner contents of each box were 4 plastic bottles. 1 inner bottle was damaged on pallet#1 Trk#775084501879. 2 plastic bottles were damaged in one box on pallet #5, Trk#775084502706. Total damage between the pallets is 15 Liters. The packages have been placed in salvage drums and held pending disposition from the shipper.

All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and anew declaration will be obtained for movement. 2. X-2024021919 During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered. The fiberboard box contained three metal cans. The cans were all packaged with closure rings and inside of plastic bags. The ring and lid on one of the cans was not sealed causing the spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024030007
item.description:
Report E-2024030007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: Saint CLAIRSVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERIGAS PROPANE, L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver of bobtail truck meets oncoming dump truck on narrow roadway and moves slightly to the right side to avoid striking mirrors. The rear tires of the bobtail truck leave the edge of the roadway and pulls the truck into the berm. Immediately after the oncoming truck passes the bobtail driver corrects his line of travel back up on the road surface. and crosses the left lane, out of control, and leaves the pavement into the ditch, striking a group of trees. During the impact, a section of piping for propane vapor on the rear of the bobtail is sheared off, resulting in a propane release. The driver was able to slow the leak at the cargo tank within 5 minutes by reseating the excess flow valve where the piping had been sheared off. A secondary bobtail truck responded to the scene and was able to safely empty the damaged bobtail by transferring the propane into the secondary truck. The damaged bobtail was towed to an impound lot that evening. The remaining propane vapor in the cargo tank was flared off the following day.

  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A THREE DAY SELECT AIR PACKAGE WAS OBSERVED WITH FROST BUILDUP ON THE OUTSIDE AND WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX IS A PREPRINTED ZEP CONCENTRATED ALL-PURPOSE CLEANER BOX WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS AND "PROTECT FROM FREEZING NOT FOR AIR TRANSPORT" PREPRINTED ON THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER INSPECTED CONTENTS TO FIND LESS THAN APPOXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING PET FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT 98568E, KHARTUNERZ, 41421 DATE ST, SUITE 108, MURRIETA CA 92562.

  • Description: 1.X-2024021779 SequenceEvent: The package was discovered by the power turn for the NCs to be scanned. Once discovered we promptly cleaned the material up and placed it in a proper setup to be brought back to the Hazardous cage to be processed. DescribePack: Inside the box there is a plastic pail. On the bottle of the plastic pail, it opened. The whole entire bottom of the Plastic pail is falling off and it is leaking all of its powder. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a hazardous bag alongside a proper red tote to contain all the release. What released was swept up and placed in the proper bag/tote as well. 2. X-2024021782 SequenceEvent: Package was found at the power turn where we process NCs. Package was discovered and quickly cleaned up and placed in a hazmat bag and also in a red tote to be processed in our hazmat cage. DescribePack: The package has failure in the plastic pail inside the Box. It is cracked heavily at the bottom and is leaking a lot of its inner contents inside of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a hazmat bag to catch all of the powder that is releasing from the plastic pail. The contents that leaked was also placed in the hazmat bag.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/7/2024 at approximately 1830, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4678718 at the ramp facility in Chicago, reporting a corrosive spill. The shipment consisted of 58 plastic jerricans, one of which showed evidence of spillage. Further investigation revealed that the jerrican in question had a loose closure, confirming spillage. The package was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had been improperly loaded into the trailer which caused the spill incident to occur by the packing becoming crushed. Once it was discovered, action was taken to isolate the scene from package handlers and to contain all damaged packages affected, including the culprit package within the hazmat processing area for further investigation and processing. DescribePack: Package had been poorly loaded into the trailer by the previous station, that the package had become crushed from the weight of the packages on top of it. One bottle had been crushed enough to be punctured and leak. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Effort was taken to mitigate the release effects by containing the damaged boxes and culprit hazmat in hazmat bags and totes and neutralizing the spill with an absorbent spill aid.

THE CONTAINER LEAKED DUE TO HAVING A POOR SEAL AROUND THE TOP FROM A WARPED LID. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A REGULATED DANGEROUS GOODS WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR SERVICE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT 0VE277, SN CONSOLIDATION, 193 LAUREL FOREST CIRCLE, ATLANTA GA 30342.

  • City: HONOLULU

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024021589: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN HONOLULU, HAWAII, CONTENTS OF ONE BLACK HEAVY PLASTIC BAG WAS INSPECTED. ONE INNER BOX WITH A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING WAS FOUND INSIDE THE BAG. INSPECTION OF THIS INNER BOX REVEALED TWO AEROSOL CANS OF CVS SPORT 50 CLEAR SPRAY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST BAG CONTAINING THE LTD QTY MARKED BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. X-2024021906: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN HONOLULU, HAWAII, CONTENTS OF ONE BLACK HEAVY PLASTIC BAG OFFERED AIR SERVICE TO UPS WERE INSPECTED. ONE INNER BOX WITH A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING WAS FOUND INSIDE THE BAG. INSPECTION OF THIS INNER BOX REVEALED TWO BIOFREEZE GEL PAIN RELIEVERS AND ONE BIOFREEZE ROLL ON TOPICAL PAIN RELIEVER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST BAG CONTAINING THE LTD QTY MARKED BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024030150
item.description:
Report X-2024030150

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-12
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was coming back to the station because it was unable to be delivered. The package was staged on the middle of the truck shelf, and it fell off causing the tops of bottles to come loose and the bottles leaked out. The driver immediately put down cardboard to soak up the spill and the box was placed inside a plastic tote and was returned to the station and placed inside the hazmat cage. All liquid which spilled inside the delivery truck was cleaned with old cardboard and was placed inside ethe salvage drum with the damaged product. DescribePack: The tops of the four bottles are missing and the inner seals of the containers are open from the fall. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: cardboard was used to soak up all the spilled liquid and the bottles was turned right side up.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being loaded into the delivery vehicle and it was dropped causing the tops of the containers to come loose and cause an inner leak inside the box. When it was discovered that the box was leaking absorbent and cardboard were placed down and the package was placed into a plastic hazmat tote and placed into the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The containers have loose caps, and the box shows visible signs of leakage, and it has two baseball size holes on the left and right side of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent and cardboard were placed down to absorb any liquid that came out of the box.
